text: Hobart Ray Brown (February 27, 1934 - November 7, 2007) was an American sculptor. He was known for finding the Kinetic Sculpture Race in 1969. Brown was born on February 27, 1934 in Hess, Oklahoma. He was raised in Los Angeles, California. Brown studied at Van Nuys High School, just a few classes from Marilyn Monroe. He was divorced two times. Brown had four children. Brown had a stroke in May 2007. Brown died on November 7, 2007 from pneumonia in Redwood City, California, aged 73.Hobart Brown, 73; artist founded wacky yearly sculpture race in the Los Angeles Times ==References== ==Other websites== * Hobart Brown: A life in Pictures * Hobart Brown - Virtual Gallery Category:1934 births Category:2007 deaths Category:Deaths from pneumonia Category:American sculptors Category:People from Oklahoma Category:Artists from Los Angeles
